lexUnit.name: smirk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: smile in an irritatingly smug or silly way.

sentence.text: Wolsey played with the gold pendant around his neck and smirked patronisingly at Agrippa as if he was a favourite son .
I played with the dumpy stem of the brandy glass , smirking at Ashley through the candle flame .
He turned and smirked at Elinor .
A pink carnation smirked at her from a transparent vase on the table .
Sarah smirked at him nastily .
Andreyev smirked at the old man 's passion .
She was wearing high-heeled shoes -- which is very unusual for a First Spiritualist -- and she was smirking at people as if she was at a cocktail party rather than morning service .
As with Ben Johnson most South Africans smirked openly at these revelations .
But he only smirked at them maliciously and kept silent . )
Swire Sugden sat smirking in his black Mercedes with two of his heavy mob standing by .
Dr Ali smirked in triumph .
The headmaster smirked to himself , chuckled , and drew the edge of his right hand carefully along his moustache .

There was Mr Pendlebury , red-faced with the constriction of his stock and sporting a gold-embroidered waistcoat which tinkled with dangling fobs and seals , bowing over Sophie 's hand and smirking with the confidence of prior acquaintance .
So , snug in woolly bear and dry suit , smirking with excitement , I attached my lung and all the other necessities to my BCD .
She always smiled and chatted with them and they were overcome with wonder , while I would stand by , smirking with pride because I shared her glory .
Shamlou smirked with satisfaction .
She sat there smirking for a long time .
His secretary , Shirley , smirks from behind her desk , self-righteous at being at her post before the boss , even though she is at this moment inspecting her face in a compact mirror .
The doctor smirked again .
Benson was smirking slightly .
Wishart smirked and leaned forward , steepling his fingers .
She smirked and dismissed Athelstan with a flicker of her eyes .
The Prince smirked and indicated that a steward should bring forward two chairs .
